Fields.DialogueText: Antoniotto?
Come, come, come, and make eyes at me down at the Old Bull and Bush...
Can you stop singing for a minute?
Come, come drink some port wine with me, down at the Old Bull and Bush...
We need you in...
Do, do have a drink or two down at the Old Bull and Bush...
Antoniotto!
Capitano! Salve! I didn't see you come in. Were you standing there for long?

Fields.MenuText: No, but pay more attention in the future, please.
I may not have heard the full concert, but I caught the last set.
Yes, now listen.

Fields.DialogueText: My apologies, sir.
Capitano, you should appreciate that a talented songstress is among your crew.
My apologies, I get carried away sometimes.
Uh-huh. Listen, I need you in position for drills. We've got....
Aspetti - I sense danger incoming. Morganas approach.
Then I need you in position for that.
@BATTLE
Captain, I compiled a full report of what we're up against.
Molto bene! Danger? Adventure? I'm so excited to hear.
Report, Lieutenant.
The waters ahead are indeed dangerous. Besides the threat of Morganas, there are reports of merchant ships being raided by pirates.
Pirates? Real pirates?
Don't get too excited...
Captain, do we maintain our current course?

Fields.MenuText: Push on. Destroy anything in our path.
Proceed with caution...
Danger builds character.

Fields.DialogueText: Right, as we do.
Noted, sir.
It can also destroy.
I've heard great tales of pirates. Some amass enough treasure to fill an entire fleet of cargo ships.
*ALARM*
Let's hold off on the tall tales for now and deal with these Morganas.
To battle.
@BATTLE
Capitano?
Yes?
Do you think we will ever encounter real pirates?

Fields.MenuText: Let's hope not.
Unlucky for them if we do.
Best not to wish for it.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's hope so.
So hostile, Capitano.
In some ways I do...
You understand they're dangerous, don't you?
Sì, lo so. And yet, there's something romantic about their grand adventures at sea.
Killing and looting the innocent?
All the new lands they explore, vast treasures and the thrill of danger around every corner...
We do that now, minus the riches...
I've dreamed of living the life of a pirate. Singing long ballads at sea as we drench ourselves in diamonds, jewels and pearls.
I sincerely doubt any pirate lives that sort of life.
*ALARM*
We have more pressing matters to attend to.
Sì, capitano!
@BATTLE
Captain?
What's wrong?
We've come across a burning vessel. There appears to be a survivor drifting in a lifeboat.
A Morgana attack?
I'm not sure. The majority of the ship was left intact, which differs from most Morgana attacks.
Should we bring the survivor aboard?

Fields.MenuText: No one deserves to die alone, at sea.
Yes, but be watchful. It could be a Morgana trap.
Yes, but don't assume the survivor is friendly. Pirates seem almost as thick in the water as Morganas out here.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you'd say that, Captain. We're already on course to collect him.
Understood. Still, what threat could one man pose?
One man isn't a match for Antoniotto.
Bring him on board. Once he's settled, get whatever information you can from him regarding the attack on his ship.
Sir.
*some time later*
My, my, quite the disaster out there.
We need to be careful. Whatever caused it might still be out there.
Capitán! Capitán, I can't thank you enough for the mercy you've shown me.
What happened out there? How did you end up—
We were attacked... I-I... I was sure I would perish with the rest of my crew. That some Morgana would rise out of the water and... and...
It's all right. You're safe now.
*ALARM*
No... no, on these seas, we're never safe.
Scusi. I beg to differ.
@BATTLE
That's another Morgana you've defeated... I didn't know it was possible.
It isn't easy, but it's possible.
Now, please, tell us who you are, and what happened.
My crew and I, we're merchant traders. We were on route when pirates overtook the ship, stole our goods and set fire to the vessel.
Pirates, I knew it...
I've lost everything. Please, Capitán, allow me to stay on board, to work for you. I am forever in your debt.

Fields.MenuText: Is there anyone we can contact to confirm you're who you say you are? No offense.
How will you contribute?
How do I know you won't seek revenge for the deaths of your crew?

Fields.DialogueText: No offense taken! I have family, in a little village near Los Peñones, but... I don't know how easy it would be for you to reach them. It's very isolated.
I am handy and learn quickly, I give you my word. Just tell me what I can do.
It is not in my nature, Capitán. As much as I loved my crew, revenge is simply not an option.
The little darling is harmless. And I'd like to hear more of these pirates.
He's a bit strange, but poses no threat.
I defer to our Belle. Raoul, you may stay on the ship. For now.
Oh, thank you, thank you, Capitán. I promise, you won't regret this.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant, may I have a word?
Of course, sir.
What do you make of this Raoul character?
To call him strange would be putting it lightly.
He's been through hell, though.
Raoul follows around Antoniotto like a sick puppy. Something about her voice entrances him. It could be he's just a tad off.
Do you think we can get any useful intelligence out of him? I'd dearly like to know more about the pirates who attacked his ship.
So we're... pirate hunters now?

Fields.MenuText: My aim is to keep these waters safe.
I believe in being prepared.
We're having a hard enough time collecting resources without the competition.

Fields.DialogueText: A noble cause.
I can respect that.
You're beginning to speak like those pirates.
Still... pardon my presumption, but our focus must be on the war and Morganas. We cannot take on the world, Captain.
You're not wrong.
*ALARM*
Looks as if it's that time.
Let's go.
@BATTLE
Come to the station, jump from the train. March at the double, from lover's lane. Then in the glen where the roses entwine, lay down your arms and surrender to mine.
Hum... hum... hum...
My sweetheart is a soldier, handsome as can be but suddenly they sent him, away across the sea.
Hum... hum... hum...
May I interrupt this performance?
You should ask Raoul! I believe he's enjoying it even more than I am.
Lady Antoniotto has a soothing voice, something akin to a siren on the sea. It's calming.
I'll try to keep the interruption brief, then. Raoul, I need you to tell me more about these pirates.
You really dislike pirates, don't you, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I hate pirates.
I have no vendetta against them. But they're making these seas unsafe.
There are certainly things I dislike more.

Fields.DialogueText: Hate is a strong word.
If you say so.
You don't say?
Have you heard of the famous Vincenzo Gambi?
The pirate who hacked his victims with an axe?
Beh si - but, violence aside, I've heard stories of Vincenzo hoarding more gold than any person could spend in a thousand lifetimes.
You don't say?
Yeah, there are ways to build a fortune without leaving a trail of corpses.
*ALARM*
I-I think I'll go hide, now.
The poor man.
@BATTLE
Capitano?
Yes?
You missed my cabaret performance for the crew.
Oh, I was just...
Just being boring. The crew loved it so much I had three encore requests.
Good for you.
... Do you think I have a good voice?

Fields.MenuText: You have the voice of an angel.
I'm not one to judge.
I don't mean to be cruel, but I'd rank you somewhere below stray cats in heat.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano! You're going to make me blush.
Coward.
How rude!
No, listen. One day, I would like to perform in front of a large crowd. Thousands will chant my name. "Introducing the magnificent, the beautiful, the vixen of the sea... Antoniotto."
You're quite the dreamer.
Dreams and hopes are what win the war, Capitano.
I suppose...
*ALARM*
The Morgana are hopeless killers. Be happy you are able to dream.
I dream of sinking each of their ships.
@BATTLE
Captain. We've made contact with an unidentified ship.
I saw that... what's going on?
They are requesting aid. They have several sick on board.
I'm not seeing any markings on that vessel. Do we have any reason to believe they're not pirates?
I'd say it hardly matters, Captain. Given the state of their vessel, they would stand no chance against Antoniotto. They'd have to have a death wish to attack us.

Fields.MenuText: Right. We need to help those in need.
Pirates are a crafty bunch.
If they attacked us in their own ship. If we get careless and they get on board, they can make one hell of a mess.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit.
They aren't suicidal, though.
Point taken.
Let's see what they need. Have Antoniotto escort them in. But I want you to prepare for combat, in case they try anything.
Will do, sir.
*some time later*
I see those men approaching, Capitán. Is everything all right?
Everything will be fine, Raoul.
Greetings. My name is Montcalm, and I represent a group of traders seeking assistance.
Welcome aboard. Your crew seems unwell.
Which is why we came to you as soon as we saw your ship.
You're not a pirate, are you?
No, of course not. We dive for sunken treasures left in the wreckages of ships and trade amongst our network.
I do like the sound of that.
During one particular dive, we uncovered an especially rare treasure.
Rare? How intriguing...
But we have been at sea for a long time and we've been hit with some sort of sickness. We don't have enough medicine to reach shore.
Hm.
*ALARM*
We are too sick to fight, Captain.
Don't worry - we'll handle this.
@BATTLE
Word of warning before we begin. Morganas have been sighted in the region, and this meeting could come to an abrupt end at any time.
Understood, Captain.
So, about this rare treasure...
It's a red diamond. The rarest of all diamonds, we've never seen anything like it. Reportedly, it could be sold for millions. However, without medicine, we won't live to sell it.
A red diamond. Such a thing exists?
I've heard tales...
Please, give us the medicine we need and we will trade for other treasures we've acquired during our travels. We have gold, artifacts and jewels.
Take the offer, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Relax. We don't make people bargain for life-saving medicines.
The offer does sound beneficial on both ends.
Let's let our medical people figure out what you need, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: But, all those riches...
It's a win-win.
You don't have to sound so cold...
Very well. Raoul, time to prove your worth. Get some antibiotics and basic supplies from sick bay and deliver it to their ship. Take what you believe is a fair exchange in treasure.
Ah, of course, Capitán. I'll make the fairest of trades - I won't let you down.
Thank you, we owe you our lives. May the seas be kind to you.
Let's make our way to your ship, Montcalm.
If you come across another one of those red diamonds, send it our way!
*sigh*
I can't wait to see what treasure Raoul brings.
@BATTLE
Please. Call it a contribution to the war effort.
Thank you, Captain. But we have people with clearly infected wounds. If we could start there....
Capitán, I have returned with gold, ruby and pearls.
Well done, my darling. Look at all this treasure.
More than a fair trade.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some things to attend to.
Wait, tell us about the ship-
That was strange, even by Raoul's standards. What has him so worked up?

Fields.MenuText: The excitement from this glorious haul, I assume.
Something he saw on Montcalm's ship?
Let's find out.

Fields.DialogueText: We should speak to him.
If so, we should find out what it was.
I absolutely agree.
Right. Let's grab him before he can...
It will have to wait. I sense Morganas approaching.
Then let's deal with them.
@BATTLE
Raoul?
Oh. Capitán! What a surprise.
You've been acting strange ever since you boarded that trader's ship.
Have I? I can't think of any reason why that might be true.
Stop. You're embarrassing us both.
I'm telling the truth, I promise!

Fields.MenuText: You can tell me what's going on. It's okay.
Tell me or find yourself swimming back to shore.
Tell me and there's an extra serving of dinner in it for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... I suppose... maybe...
I-I can't swim well.
Dinner? Hmm... not a bad trade.
When... when I was on Montcalm's ship, I saw a symbol.
Symbol? What sort of symbol?
A pirate symbol. The same symbol I saw on the ship that attacked my crew and left me for dead.
Why didn't you come clean sooner?
I... might have done something... foolhardy.
What did you do?
Raoul.
While sorting through their treasure, I spotted the red diamond. And in that moment, it seemed to me that there would be no better revenge for their actions than... stealing it.
Huh. Well, they're not gonna like that.
I know, I know! I don't know what came over me...
Where is it?
I... lost track of it during our last battle. I don't know where it is.
*ALARM*
We'll discuss this later.
@BATTLE
Antoniotto.
All the nice girls love a sailor, all the nice girls love a tar. For there's something about a sailor. Well you know what sailors are.
I know you see me this time.
Sing with me, Capitano!
Bright and breezy, free and easy. He's the ladies' pride and joy. He falls in love with Kate and Jane then he's off to the sea again, ships ahoy.
I must say you are getting better at this.
Thank you, Capitano. That means a lot.
I came to discuss Raoul. He said those traders were the same pirates who raided his ship.
You're kidding.
That's not all... he stole the red diamond and lost it somewhere on our ship.
W-what? We have a rare diamond somewhere on the ship?
What a magnificently crafty man. You know what this means?

Fields.MenuText: Angry pirates will soon be visiting us.
Raoul can't be trusted.
We're rich?

Fields.DialogueText: They are no match for me.
Don't be so hard on him.
Beyond words.
But it means we are technically pirates.
No.
Think about it, we stole from a ship full of sick people. That's more ruthless than any pirate I've heard of.
It's not stealing. It's recovering stolen property in order to-
They will write stories about us. Children will hear of our adventures in schools and carry dolls of us.
We need to find this diamond before trouble finds us.
*ALARM*
Deal with the Morgana and I'll locate the diamond.
@BATTLE
Captain. We have visitors.
The pirates have returned for me.
That's... not an insignificant fleet, actually. I don't think any of those ships are a day younger than thirty years, but look at the guns.
You won't let them hurt me, will you, Capitán? Capitán?
You're a damn fool. If anything happens, it's your fault alone.
Raoul, find a crate to hide in until this blows over. They might kill you on sight, otherwise.
Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you.
Go. Now.
Captain, why protect that dishonest nit-wit?

Fields.MenuText: Because I'm not in the habit of giving pirates a damn thing.
He is part of this crew, and I've committed myself to keeping the entire crew safe.
Because he's kind of sweet, don't you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, when you put it like that...
Understood.
So sweet he'll make your teeth rot.
Don't worry, I'll handle the pirates.
Capitano... pirates are approaching from the north and Morganas from the south.
Damn it, not now.
Should I be worried?
If we fear, we've already lost. Set course for the Morganas so those pirates can see what we're capable of.
I like your style, sir.
@BATTLE
Yeah. They stole those recently.
Tsk, tsk, tsk... and I thought we were all friends.
And I think you've been preying on civilian ships while all of humanity is at war. Only one of us can be right.
I'm not here to debate ethics with an imperialist stooge. Where's that filthy little thief merchant of yours? I want to introduce him to my blade.
I won't have you on our ship and threatening our crew, pirate.
Guilty as charged. But we're not just any pirates. We are of La Coupe-Gorge. A rather large union of pirates, if you will.
Your mothers must be so proud.
Enough. Hand over the red diamond. I want it back, now.
What makes you think we have it?
A shady little man boards our ship and paws his way through our riches. When he leaves, the diamond is gone. What other explanation do you have to offer?

Fields.MenuText: One of your crew members stole it. You can't ever trust a pirate.
I don't know what to tell you... take better care of your things?
The ocean is a big place. The bottom of it is a good place to start searching.

Fields.DialogueText: None of my crew would dare steal the diamond. They know the price of betraying La Coupe-Gorge.
Ha! A comedian. Even in your final minutes.
I have a feeling you'll find yourself there if you don't cooperate.
Look, we are tired and rather moody from all of this. The only reason you're all still alive is because we need that diamond back. Our ruthless leader Gaspard demands it.
We don't have the damned thing. Believe me, I've looked.
In that case, I'll grant you time to produce the diamond and will return in the coming days with Gaspard himself to collect. If you do not have it, I will kill everyone on this ship.
I'll even let you keep all the treasure we traded if you give me the severed head of that thief Raoul.
Enough. Go away.
Farewell, my new best friends.
Raoul, you fool...
@BATTLE
Don't look so annoyed. Didn't you hear? We're going to meet "Gaspard himself."
Captain, they may not be as fast as us, and their armor isn't in great shape, but just in numbers alone...
I know. But these idiots are making the seas even less safe than they would otherwise be - and if the Morganas get them, then all of that weaponry and steel gets repurposed by the real enemy.
Speaking of which...
Raoul, get out of that crate.
Thank goodness. This crate... is full of rotting fish.
We are in debt to a union of pirates thanks to you. The entire ship is at risk.
I know! I know this entire situation is my fault.
No. It's not. You showed terrible judgment, sure, but they're pirates. They were a problem regardless.
I know, I know. I've been looking everywhere! I just don't know where it could have ended up.
What do we do, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Keep searching until we find the diamond.
Prepare for the fight of our lives.
More intelligence would be nice. I'd like to know where these idiots get ammunition for all their stolen guns. Assuming they do.

Fields.DialogueText: We've checked everywhere. Still, I suppose it's worth trying again.
A fight we will lose. That pirate union has us badly outgunned and outnumbered.
Our investigative resources are pretty thin out here, Captain.
I'm not inclined toward pessimism - but it's fair to say that we don't have much time to figure this out.
*ALARM*
Back into the fetid crate I go...
@BATTLE
I would like to know where that diamond is, though.
Antoniotto, I need a moment.
I know. You've come to say "I told you so."
Not at all. But you must admit that pirates aren't as charming as you thought...
Fine, but that doesn't sway me from wanting to be a pirate myself one day.
Still? After all that?
What about being a pirate that only targets other pirates? Or, better yet, Morganas? Not all pirates have to prey on the weak and innocent. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: That doesn't sound very safe.
So, basically, what we're doing now. Only you'd have an eyepatch and a parrot on your shoulder or something.
If that were your mission, I'd have half a mind to join you.

Fields.DialogueText: When have we ever been safe, Capitano?
I *would* look fantastic with a parrot.
You would?
I'm starting to feel much closer to you, Capitano. It's as if all of this excitement has made me realize who I like having in my corner...
Same here.
I'm happy you agree.
*ALARM*
Let's take care of the trash, together.
@BATTLE
Capitán! You must join us, Antoniotto tells great tales of pirates.
More pirates...
Have you all heard the story of the great Vincenzo Gambi? He was a violent swashbuckler who terrorized the Gulf of Mexico.
Is he related to Montcalm?
Ha, ha, ha. Davros has a sense of humor.
Shut up. I'm still mad at you.
Vincenzo was notorious for his treatment of prisoners. He would lock them away in horrid conditions and make cruel jokes of them.
On second thought, perhaps I don't like this story, after all.
After decades of terror, he one day withheld a large portion of a prize from his crew and they conspired against him. Eventually, they decapitated him with an axe.
A happy ending, then.
Capitano, what do you make of this?

Fields.MenuText: Pirates are a ruthless bunch, even to their own.
He had it coming.
I'm not a fan of brutal killings, no matter whose neck is on the block.

Fields.DialogueText: That's a good lesson to take with us.
No one deserves that.
Agreed. Everyone deserves a chance for redemption.
I think that's enough pirate talk for me...
There he goes, acting like he's hiding something...
I feel a disturbance... there are Morganas approaching.
To battle.
@BATTLE
Capitán?
What is it?
The pirates... it won't be much longer before they return, will it?
I'm so sorry, Capitán. To think my foolish act has put you and your crew in so much jeopardy...
They're pirates, Raoul. If they think they can take us, they would've tried no matter what you'd done.
What do we do, then?
We have no choice but to fight or talk our way out of it. Either way, I've been in worse situations.
You are brave, Capitán. I will... do my best to be brave as well, when the pirates return.
Good.
... What do you think of me, Capitán?

Fields.MenuText: Even though you're a headache, I still like you.
Ask me again when the pirates are out of the way.
Honestly? You're mostly harmless, but I can't say I entirely trust your judgment.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. That... means much to me.
I will look forward to the day.
I... deserve that, I'll admit.
*ALARM*
M-more Morganas?
Not everyone can be a hero, I suppose...
@BATTLE
Captain. La Coupe-Gorge has returned.
We're surrounded.
This is it. Let me handle this, I want both of you to rally the crew and prepare for battle.
We're not leaving you to deal with these bottom-feeders on your own.
I agree with Davros. What if something happened to you?

Fields.MenuText: This is my ship. I'll take responsibility.
Then take that as a cue to fire everything we have.
Tell the crew that I'm proud of them.

Fields.DialogueText: No...
I'll sink every last ship if they touch you.
They are proud of you, Capitano.
Now, go.
Sir.
Here we go...
Knock, knock... who's there?
Shut up, Montcalm. Are you the captain of this ship?
I am. And I suppose you're the much-talked-of Gaspard, correct?
You have something that belongs to me.
And you have a fleet that you're not putting to very constructive use.
*ALARM*
That means Morganas are coming.
Very well. I'll allow the Captain to see to them before we continue our conversation.
You'll let us expend ammunition and protect you from a demon fleet? You're all heart.
@BATTLE
We won't fire on you while you're doing it. Take what you can get.
You fight well, Captain. It would be a shame to die here after such a hard fought victory.
The diamond, now.
I-I know where it is.
There's that thieving bastard. I'm going to kill him...
Leave him be.
Tell us, thief. Where is the diamond?
We do not have it. The person who has it is... Montcalm.
What kind of nonsense are you talking about?
Let me cut his throat, sir.
I would never lie. I overheard him, talking about stealing the diamond, when I delivered the medicine to his ship. I told you as much, didn't I, Capitán?

Fields.MenuText: Uh, yeah. That's right, what he said...
This is the first I'm hearing of it.
What are you doing, Raoul...?

Fields.DialogueText: Montcalm has the diamond in his pocket.
Montcalm has the diamond in his pocket.
Montcalm has the diamond in his pocket.
Montcalm would never betray me.
If so, then there's no harm in checking his pockets.
Montcalm?
Heh. With pleasure, sir.
What is this? The diamond?!
N-no. I don't understand. It's not what it looks like.
He had it all along and was going to frame us to get away with it.
Montcalm, you blasted traitor. Men! Have Montcalm escorted back to our ship. He will make a great feast for the sharks that lie below.
This isn't right... this isn't right!
So, then?
*ALARM*
Take care of these Morganas, would you, while I ponder what to do with you?
... This is not the life I was expecting when I joined the Navy.
@BATTLE
Listen, all of this is stupid. There's not a country in the world right now that wouldn't offer you amnesty if you took your fleet and used it against the common enemy.
Do the right thing. Don't make us kill all of you.
We all have our own battles to fight, Captain. I'm not going to spend my life propping up governments too sorry to protect themselves.
You're brave fighters, I'll give you that.
I've made my decision.
Go on...
Since you are innocent and gave up the man responsible, I'll spare your lives. However, I am still taking all of your cargo with me for the inconvenience.
You try it, you lose at least half your fleet.
Perhaps, one day, our paths will cross again. Farewell, Captain.
Okay, Raoul. What did you do?
Heh.
I slipped the diamond in Montcalm's pocket when he came aboard.
I thought you lost it.
I did. And then I found it.
I don't know whether to hug you or punch you in the face.
Considering we're all no worse for the wear, I would prefer we consider ourselves even.
Well, good work. I didn't think you had it in you.
@BATTLE
It was worth a try.
Capitano, the pirates left without a shot fired. What happened?
Raoul found the diamond and planted it on Montcalm. They took him away to be executed.
My word... Raoul, is this true?
What I lack in bravery, I make up for in craftiness.
My darling. How wonderful - you are a true hero!
Don't make me blush, Antoniotto.
Even though you got us into this mess, I must admit, that was impressive. Good work, Raoul.
Thank you... thank you both..
So, what do we do next, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Resume our patrols. What else?
We're not getting you a parrot.
We need to report this pirate fleet, for one thing.

Fields.DialogueText: You could have said it more inspirationally.
That's fair. I'd prefer something shinier.
Thinking ahead, Capitano. Good move.
*ALARM*
For now, I'd suggest you focus on Morganas.
@BATTLE
I didn't want to engage them with Morganas waiting to swoop in, but they're a problem that's going to need solving.
Someday. he'll come along, the man I love. And he'll be big and strong, the man I love. And when he comes my way, I'll do my best to make him stay.
Antoniotto?
Oh. Capitano, caught me singing again...
Keep going, your voice is enchanting.
Of course!
He'll look at me and smile, I'll understand. Then in a little while, he'll take my hand. And though it seems absurd, I know we both won't say a word.
... Do you really enjoy my singing?

Fields.MenuText: I enjoy everything about you.
It's the only thing that gets me through the long nights.
It's okay, I guess.

Fields.DialogueText: You're making me blush...
I—I didn't know my voice had that effect on you.
You wouldn't know talent if it smacked you on the head.
Capitano... I have to ask you a question.
*ALARM*
It will have to wait. Let's deal with these Morganas first.
@BATTLE
No Morgana sightings since that last big brawl. I think the region may have a little room to breathe for a while.
Good. Those things are getting on my last nerve.
Now, what were you going to ask me?
Despite our recent experiences, I'm still of the mind that I would like to pursue a life of piracy, sometime in the future.
But I want to know that, no matter what my future holds, well... that you'll still stay by my side.
Really?
I've realized you are quite important to me, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: We're a good team, Antoniotto. I wouldn't leave you.
I can't imagine life without you, Antoniotto.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm so happy to know you feel the same way.
Why, Capitano... you're going to make me blush. Again.
I think we have an exciting future ahead of us, Antoniotto.
I couldn't agree more, Capitano.
